meanings.definition: Express (an idea or feeling) in different words or a new way.
meanings.sent1: She tried to rearticulate her thoughts to make them easier to understand.
meanings.sent2: I need to rearticulate my feelings so that others can comprehend them better.
meanings.sent3: He decided to rearticulate his excitement about the upcoming event in a funnier way.
meanings.sent4: The artist rearticulated her emotions on the canvas with vibrant colors and bold strokes.
meanings.sent5: In order to remember the speech, she would rearticulate each point in her mind.

meanings.definition: Repeat or restate something in a clearer or more coherent manner.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the student to rearticulate the main idea of the story.
meanings.sent2: It is important to rearticulate the instructions to avoid any confusion.
meanings.sent3: He had to rearticulate the joke several times before everyone understood it.
meanings.sent4: The leader rearticulated the vision for the team, inspiring them to work harder.
meanings.sent5: To ensure clarity, she would often rearticulate her thoughts during the presentation.
